New Records: Darius Garland scored 25 points, marking a significant contribution to the Cavaliers' victory.
The Cavaliers extended their winning streak to 10 games, a franchise record.
The Cavaliers' 31-4 record through 35 games is one of the best in NBA history.
Evan Mobley added 17 points and demonstrated strong defensive play.
Key Match Events: The Cavaliers had a strong 24-6 run in the second quarter, building a significant lead.
Evan Mobley's defensive play, including a key stuff on the Hornets, was a pivotal moment.
Pre-Game Insights: Isaac Okoro returned from a right shoulder sprain and was cleared to practice, adding depth to the Cavaliers' lineup.
The Hornets, with LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller returning from injuries, showed resilience in the first half but struggled overall.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse with a capacity of 19,432 fans.
The Cavaliers are set to face the Oklahoma City Thunder next, while the Hornets will take on the Phoenix Suns.
Others: The Cavaliers' 18th win in 19 home games highlights their strong home performance.
